They tend to overload employees by continuously adding and adding tasks, without demonstrating any appreciation. Place full of incompetent people (including management who got their position through nepotism),

 a) don't want to be there
b) hooked on money / union benefits

Only few dedicated, knowledgeable, highly competent that eventually leave for better positions at other companies. Corporate culture is non-transparent, you learn about big companies decision post factum, with no reasons or any additional details.

pros: The lower level staff and the benefits are great.
cons: Management is horrible. Upper management hires their friends who are incompetent and should never hold a senior management title. They also hire nonprofessionals that use vulgar language and who like to embarrass staff in front of everyone. These actions have resorted in the resignation of many good workers and have made it very difficult  for the remaining staff to do their jobs effectively. You will never be appreciated no matter how good you are at your job. They will pile excessive work on you and ridicule you for every little thing.  Their goals and timelines are unrealistic. This toxic environment will consume your whole life and you began to feel ill about your decision to work there. The novelty will wear off after about 3 weeks and you will need to look for another job immediately so don't waste your time and efforts.

pros: It's for profit now and alot of employees lost their jobs.

pros:
Great friendly (for the most part) co-workers. 
Good benefit package.
cons:
Overtime on your own time: work load is HUMONGOUS however overtime is never approved. 
Too much paperwork which results in no time for the patients. 
Questionable management: hit or miss. Mostly miss. 
Disconnect in all departments. No structure. 
Constant threat of layoffs. Employees are the last ones to know about it. 
Very little care for patients. It's about money. 
Outdated working systems. Use of multiple systems that do not sync.
No reward/encouragement system in place. 
Micromanagement is seems to be first to be tought to inexperienced management. 
Employees paying for "company organized"  Christmas Party......  Enought said!

pros: You will learn a lot and wear many hats.
cons: Senior management makes terrible decisions. They have inflated salaries and spend their days pretending to care about patient and staff issues. There is no transparency. Senior management places staff in positions where they have little to no experience, usually friends of theirs to protect them from being laid off. You can work 15 hours/day, come in on the weekends, and help every department in the organization, and yet, you'll still never get promoted or a pay increase. You will also get in trouble for the most absurd reasons (i.e., talking to a colleague about work related items and from a distance, a higher up assumes you're wasting time/gossiping). Stay far away from this place -- you will absolutely regret working here.

pros: The employees genuinely care about the clients that receive services. Most employees go above and beyond to help the clients as well as their colleagues.
cons: Management hides behind Human Resources and use layoffs as a way to manage poor performance. A lot of "people decisions" are based on who likes you and Senior Management looks down on the Managers and lay people who are providing hands on care the clients. They really try to be a corporate environment but they really are not. CenterLight needs to learn how to treat their employees.

pros: Great training,  great benefits, great pay, great human resources,
cons: Worked in housing for not long at all ,Co workers are very cool just a bit in-considerate bout your feelings , its good pay and greatBenefits  but before working ask your self is it worth it working with individuals that doesn't care bout your work ethic and how much work you put into it, overall the job is great, just be lucky if they like you and I saw couple illegal things.

review_title: Destruction of what once was a healthy strong organization.
pros: Staff are committed and caring. Hardworking. Benefits are good, so are salaries. Some areaway above market which is not sustainable when at the same time business outcomes are not good.
cons:
Loeb & Troper has been allowed to run the company in the ground while the board applauds it. Who has EVER seen a product handed over to an outsourced firm with such increase of power with every year (for what 15 years?) while the company implodes. 

Greed and poor management caused these problems. 

Hire leadership with actual change management skills and better attitudes.  Too many egocentrically driven personalities and that's where you end up.

review_title: originally very supportive and caring staff; good boss laid off, cliquey and political
pros: Empire BCBS was the good-enough medical insurance. 403B. Overall non-management staff were compassionate, helpful and pleasant to work with. It really trickled down from the top the way thing were run - with compassion as its core value.
cons: low morale. cliquey. Since top person took over and hired the one who closed down other NYC hospital, the nursing homes were sold off to other competitors.

review_title: Do not waste your time there!!!
pros: 4 weeks of vacations plus 12 sick days, sounds good. However you don't have them until you really get them .
cons: The old management was ok.It was a laid back place. Now it is a different story. The current management there is nasty. There is no such thing as fairness and efficiency.Instead, plenty of politics.  All they wan is just enrollment and revenue.It takes months to get a simple thing done, such as ordering a pack of business cards, or reimbursement.  A lot of people are leaving this place and go to somewhere better. It is definitely  not a place to grow your profession.

pros: Seniors really appreciate your help and value of the service provided. The work and life balance is great and the benefits are the best.
cons: The organization is going through transition and changes but all for good, with time everything will fall into place. Sometimes the communication within the staff can be difficult.

job_title: RN Care Manager in Bronx, NY
pros: Excellent benefits, salary. Warm, friendly, supportive colleagues.
cons: Unstable, chaotic, unrealistic expectations. Going to work on a daily basis is like going to combat. It's impossible to get anything done because you are so busy putting out fires. Everyone's mental and physical health is at risk because it is so stressful. Management seems to be having a difficult time trying to but realistic systems/structure in place thus adding to the instability.

pros: Compensation, medical benefits and retirement plans are good.
